title: GHGSat continues to expand its methane-monitoring constellation
summary:
SAN FRANCISCO – GHGSat announced plans Nov. 7 to send two additional satellites into its greenhouse-gas-monitoring constellation. Ahead of the 30th Conference of the Parties to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change in Brazil, the Montreal-based GHGSat is preparing to expand its methane-monitoring constellation from 12 to 14 satellites. “With a constellation of […]

title: FAA to restrict commercial launches during government shutdown
summary:
The Federal Aviation Administration will temporarily limit the hours that commercial space launches can take place, citing strains on the air traffic control system during the government shutdown.
The post FAA to restrict commercial launches during government shutdown appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: The next generation of environmental intelligence: Why high-resolution satellite imagery must power our planet’s future
summary:
Imagine trying to spot an object just 30 centimeters wide from hundreds of kilometers above Earth. Years ago, I remember when “satellite view” meant blurry green blobs on a screen. Now, we can see individual trees, cars and even shadows cast by buildings. We finally have the power to witness our planet as it truly […]

title: Rheinmetall and ICEYE Partner to Build Satellites in Germany
summary:
German technology group Rheinmetall and Finnish satellite manufacturer and Earth observation data provider ICEYE have officially established a joint venture to build satellites in Germany. Rheinmetall’s partnership with ICEYE began in early 2024 following a strategic investment made through the company’s Rheinmetall Nordic subsidiary. In September 2024, Rheinmetall acquired the exclusive rights to distribute ICEYE […]
The post Rheinmetall and ICEYE Partner to Build Satellites in Germany appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Earth from Space: Branco River, Brazil
Insects on the space menu
summary: Long before humans reached orbit, insects had already shown they could handle the hurdles of spaceflight. Light, highly adaptable and nutritionally rich, these resilient animals present an attractive option for European researchers studying reliable food sources for long-duration missions.

title: Andy Stofan, Former NASA Lewis Center Director and Space Station AA Passes Away
summary: Andy Stofan, who was Director of Lewis (now Glenn) Research Center and then headed the space station program at NASA headquarters in the mid-1980s, passed away on October 26, 2025. […]

title: In-Q-Tel invests in Vast
summary:
An investment by a venture fund affiliated with the U.S. national security community in commercial space station developer Vast is not necessarily a sign of military interest in human spaceflight.

title: Live coverage: Atlas 5 makes another try to launch ViaSat-3 F2 communications satellite
summary: United Launch Alliance is counting down to a second launch attempt for an Atlas 5 rocket carrying the ViaSat-3 F2 satellite. Liftoff from pad 41 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station is scheduled for 10:16 p.m. EST (0316 UTC) at the opening of a 44-minute launch window.
